chapterTitle: Net Present Value and Other Investment Criteria

columns.text:
In this exercise, we are asked to determine the following

- the annual payment in terms of the initial cost and useful life.

- the annual payment in terms of the initial cost, useful life and rate of return.
 
- the annual payment in terms of the initial cost, useful life and rate of return with a profitability index of 2.

Let us first identify the given values in the problem.

$$
\begin{aligned}
I & = \text{Initial Cost}\\
R & = \text{Rate of Return}\\
C & = \text{ Annual Payment}\\
N & = \text{ Useful Life}\\
PI &  =2
\end{aligned}
$$

**(a)** In this case, we can find the annual cash flow by solving the payback period formula for $C$:

$$\text{Payback period} = \dfrac{\text{Initial Cost}}{\text{Cash flow per year}}$$

**(c)** In this case, we can find the annual cash flow by solving the profitability index for $C$:
The profitability index is calculated as follows:

$$\text{Profitability Index} = \dfrac{\text{Uniform Series Present value}}{\text{Initial Investment}} $$
